Generally speaking, there are two ideal periods to buy a TV: the late spring stretch when new models are announced and last year’s sets are heavily discounted to clear out inventory, and the holiday shopping season, right around [Black Friday](https://www.engadget.com/deals/we-found-the-best-black-friday-2025-deals-on-tech-from-amazon-apple-lego-ninja-and-more-ahead-of-the-big-sale-100052689.html). We’re firmly in the latter now, so if you’ve been thinking about making that big living room upgrade, it’s OK to take the plunge.  
  
To help you out, we’ve sorted through the many sales already floating around the web and picked out the best Black Friday TV deals we could find below. The current selection includes several well-reviewed sets from Samsung, LG, TCL and Hisense, but we’ll update this post through Black Friday itself as more deals pop up.

## Best Black Friday TV deals: Under $500

[**Hisense U65QF (55-inch) for $428 at Amazon ($372 off MSRP)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYWG3BL1&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Hisense+U65QF+%2855-inch%29+for+%24428+at+Amazon+%28%24372+off+MSRP%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVdHM0JMMS9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAZwe5uFEpvatHjZMoq_kOg3Q970MxMzhEgR8MYPe-x8x&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYWG3BL1%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1): The U65QF is another entry-level LED TV with [generally](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/hisense-65u65qf) [positive](https://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/hisense/u65qf) [reviews](https://www.techradar.com/televisions/hisense-u65qf-review). Most feedback around the web suggests that it can’t match the QM6K in terms of contrast, gaming features and overall accuracy, so TCL’s model should be a better buy for most. This iteration also uses Amazon’s Fire TV platform instead of the [cleaner Google TV](https://www.engadget.com/entertainment/streaming/google-tv-streamer-review-a-great-side-piece-for-your-tv-with-a-dash-of-smart-home-chops-and-inessential-ai-160034550.html). It can achieve a higher peak brightness, however, so it’s worth considering if you get particularly bad glare in your living room. This is the lowest price we’ve seen for the 55-inch model, but the 65-inch ([$548](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYW81FWH&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24548&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVc4MUZXSC9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAUfTYBnS1vyrU_HEIxqxLX6vmzcj-rsFnY0iLN010kiB&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYW81FWH%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)), 75-inch ([$748](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYWNQMQJ&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24748&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVdOUU1RSi9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAUcl2TsKpiyu0Pg6OlU4dAQhGH3Vz-jD2u85fKnhcVH6&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYWNQMQJ%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)) and 85-inch ([$998](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYWZW2VQ&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=%24998&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWVdaVzJWUS9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAbjJkDdcJ_kYAgQaOsTphG55f-KUy2fAb-tekMqnthrB&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DYWZW2VQ%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1)) models are also at all-time lows. Also at [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAX0TpjPWw1j2nKdemKiZUDlMpgoUPSMmrBc30qi8wy0h&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Fhisense-55-class-u6-series-miniled-qled-uhd-4k-hdr-smart-fire-tv-2025%2FJ3Z9Z42SLP).

## Best Black Friday TV deals: Between $500 and $1,000

[**LG B5 (55-inch) for $897 at Amazon ($100 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0FFXN5PN9&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=LG+B5+%2855-inch%29+for+%24897+at+Amazon+%28%24100+off%29&&signature=AQAAAStij0vMMQf_T6cnkrf-UJHbYsZNq-CeFGT1S65DI5aA&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FLG-Upscaling-Filmmaker-Orchestra-OLED65B5PUA-AUSZ%2Fdp%2FB0FFXN5PN9): The B5 is LG’s entry-level OLED TV for 2025. It gets you the core benefits of any OLED TV — excellent contrast, wide viewing angles, smooth motion and so on — but it can’t get as bright as the higher-end [LG C5](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DYQF1Q3Z&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=LG+C5&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL0xHLVVwc2NhbGluZy1GaWxtbWFrZXItT3JjaGVzdHJhLU9MRUQ2NUM1UFVBL2RwL0IwRFlRRjFRM1o_&signature=AQAAAZIZB28ZRuzxOjKBL43TawalQHX6ppSSVh2bdwV6ogWZ&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FLG-Upscaling-Filmmaker-Orchestra-OLED65C5PUA%2Fdp%2FB0DYQF1Q3Z), so it doesn’t look as colorful. (The C5 isn’t significantly discounted as of this writing.) It’s technically limited to a 120Hz refresh rate instead of 144Hz, too, though that isn’t a big deal unless you plan to play PC games on your TV. While not huge discount, this matches the lowest price we’ve seen for the 55-inch model. Also at [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAW5u0UwqEwRlFiXJJN3JKRyh_VlXt3NzC1_N3Hbk9Q_N&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Flg-55-class-b5-series-oled-ai-4k-uhd-smart-webos-tv-2025%2FJJ8VPZTKH9) and [LG](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=472a467b-5d76-4e49-b1e8-d1e77258dd8e&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=LG+Electronics&linkText=LG&&signature=AQAAAblK10gVUWNnR_Pu0mK1zaVw7U63VZ0eP2BmWsjUnG30&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lg.com%2Fus%2Ftvs%2Flg-oled55b5pua-oled-4k-tv).

[**TCL QM7K (65-inch) for $800 at Amazon ($200 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DVX8WJ7S&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=TCL+QM7K+%2865-inch%29+for+%24800+at+Amazon+%28%24200+off%29&&signature=AQAAAbEWGZKhp63WQdVGc_AonhQkkNhNExI_a1eSOUoaJzLG&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FTCL-55QM7K-120HZ-144HZ-Reflective-Television%2Fdp%2FB0DVX8WJ7S%2F): The TCL QM7K is a fairly sizable step-up over the QM6K, with noticeably improved contrast, brightness and color volume. It has a 144Hz refresh rate with 288Hz@1080p support as well, though like the budget model it’s limited to two HDMI 2.1 ports. And like most LED TVs, it can’t compete with a good OLED set when it comes to colors and viewing angles. This deal matches the all-time low for the 65-inch model. The [55-inch version](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=55-inch+version&&signature=AQAAARlgCVYxKHf7FWTwE2KHJ-b_Kb0NpIr6MNJ8SMI3DH12&gcReferrer=http%3A%2F%2Famazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DVWXXRDL%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1) is $30 above its previous best at $598. Also at [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAfB4TdO9wWm0W_IGhm5J0WGYoVN27dHt30beKmF4Q8LQ&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Ftcl-65-class-qm7k-series-4k-uhd-hdr-qd-mini-led-smart-tv-with-google-tv-2025%2FJ36QYTQTCT) and [Walmart](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=3719d8d4-5edd-4817-998a-91f3229e7323&itemId=walmart_transaction_15153350266&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Walmart&linkText=Walmart&&signature=AQAAAeXglp3pYccW5RhmZicolMzetFBiSq5toLuueqbJE3O0&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FTCL-65-Q-Series-4K-UHD-HDR-QD-Mini-LED-Smart-TV-with-Google-TV-65QM7K%2F15153350266).

## Best Black Friday TV deals: $1,000 and up

[**Samsung S95F (65-inch) for $2,298 at Amazon ($700 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DXMJFJ7W&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Samsung+S95F+%2865-inch%29+for+%242%2C298+at+Amazon+%28%24700+off%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBEWE1KRko3Vy9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAAdSeBFjhqCmNHmd3IQ1XZxN3UlE0yco1SzTmo6cFa-wB&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0DXMJFJ7W%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1): The S95F is a premium model that has [received](https://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/samsung/s95f-oled) [almost](https://www.flatpanelshd.com/review.php?subaction=showfull&id=1751526539) [universally](https://www.tomsguide.com/tvs/4k-tvs/samsung-s95f-oled-tv-review) [stellar](https://www.nytimes.com/wirecutter/reviews/best-oled-tv/) [reviews](https://www.wired.com/review/samsung-s95f/) for being especially bright among OLED TVs while keeping the bold colors and contrast expected from a QD-OLED panel. That brightness, combined with the display’s matte finish, means it’s especially adept at fending off glare in a bright room. It also has a 165Hz refresh rate for gaming. That said, there’s still no Dolby Vision HDR, and the matte coating means that black tones won’t look as deep in a well-lit room. It's not cheap, but this is the lowest price we’ve seen for the 65-inch model. Also at [Samsung](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=f85e63cd-e13c-4f9d-991c-9fbaadede3ac&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Samsung+Electronics&linkText=Samsung&&signature=AQAAAReSLZr-o5u-OO5DW-Gf_hglm4t0e8UcAykGrE-D0fa2&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.samsung.com%2Fus%2Ftvs%2Foled-tv%2F65-class-oled-tv-s95f-sku-qn65s95fafxza%2F) and [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAQRDR9FeyyTc8XnBL70kkK7T0Bijn9_aMcfC0dvJCYGQ&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Fsamsung-65-class-s95f-series-oled-4k-uhd-samsungvision-ai-smart-tizen-tv-2025%2FJ3ZYG2VV3P).

[**TCL QM8K (75-inch) for $1,400 at Amazon ($600 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F53HDFBR&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=TCL+QM8K+%2875-inch%29+for+%241%2C400+at+Amazon+%28%24600+off%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjBGNTNIREZCUi9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&signature=AQAAARJJiC_PUpFGsQsWMvzICSLtnssJrKPLgDEjISNj7OVd&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB0F53HDFBR%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1): If you’re willing to pay an OLED-level price but want the increased brightness of a high-end LED TV, the TCL QM8K is worth a look. It won’t be as good in a dark room as something like the Samsung S90F or LG C5, as its contrast isn’t as deep and black tones aren’t as uniformly dark. Its viewing angles are clearly worse, too. But [reviews](https://www.rtings.com/tv/reviews/tcl/qm8k) [say](https://www.cnet.com/tech/home-entertainment/tcl-qm8k-2025-review-mini-led-tv-takes-on-oled-for-less/) [it still](https://www.wired.com/review/tcl-qm8k/) [performs](https://www.tomsguide.com/tvs/8k-tvs/tcl-qm8k-qd-mini-led-tv-review) excellently compared to other LED sets, and since it gets way brighter than most OLED alternatives (especially with non-HDR content), it can better withstand glare. It also has a 144Hz refresh rate with support for 288Hz at 1080p, though it only comes with two HDMI 2.1 ports, and it’s not available in a size smaller than 65 inches. This is the best price we’ve seen for the 75-inch variant. Also at [Walmart](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=3719d8d4-5edd-4817-998a-91f3229e7323&itemId=walmart_transaction_15982522507&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Walmart&linkText=Walmart&&signature=AQAAAXSr8hqOgtxp47QM2zv6O9MMbKDY9FMkge0817eJh1fu&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FTCL-75QM8K-TV%2F15982522507).

## Best Black Friday streaming device deals

[**Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Plus for $25 at Amazon ($25 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F7Z4QZTT&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Amazon+Fire+TV+Stick+4K+Plus+for+%2425+at+Amazon+%28%2425+off%29&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRjdaNFFaVFQ_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiZmQ2MTU0YjQtMDI4YS00MDQ3LTlmNDMtMmQ3NzVkZmUxNGM5Iiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRjdaNFFaVFQiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&signature=AQAAAUxOh01o92fGAL4JJVWHouTek8aCUQ0VgLo7zSKt3Agc&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0F7Z4QZTT): The newly rebranded Fire TV Stick 4K Plus offers the same core experience as the more expensive Fire TV Stick 4K Max, only it has a slightly slower processor, half the storage space (8GB) and Wi-Fi 6 support instead of Wi-Fi 6E. For most people who just want to stream casually, those shouldn’t be huge losses. Just keep in mind that its Fire OS interface is still [fairly ad-heavy](https://www.engadget.com/amazons-fire-tv-stick-4k-max-is-better-as-a-retro-gaming-device-than-a-streamer-160022685.html) and prioritizes Amazon’s own apps over everything else. This deal is $3 more than the device’s all-time low but ties the best price we’ve seen in the past year. Also at [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=fd6154b4-028a-4047-9f43-2d775dfe14c9&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAU3kGSjHsEXULeQGYFSTRTVP4Gt8-QUPQ7JOMYb6WxWQ&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Famazon-fire-tv-stick-4k-plus-newest-model-ai-powered-fire-tv-search-wi-fi-6-streaming-device-8-gb-free-live-tv-black%2FJ39TLS6QVZ%2Fsku%2F6644638).

It only streams up to 1080p and runs a bit choppier than Amazon’s 4K models since it has a slower chip and a meager 1GB of RAM. The usual complaints with Fire OS still apply, too. But if you just want to add streaming apps to an aging TV for as little as possible, it'll work well enough. This discount matches the best price we’ve tracked.
